intro: Kosteletzkya augusti, commonly known as the yellow marsh mallow, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in shallow water or damp soil, often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. The plant features broad, heart-shaped leaves and produces showy yellow flowers with a distinctive, woolly appearance. Its botanical name honors the 19th-century botanist Johann Friedrich Kosteletzký. Kosteletzkya augusti is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local ecosystems.
